newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland and Latvia sign free-trade agreement.
newsitem.headline: Poland and Latvia sign free-trade agreement.

text.p: Poland and Latvia on Monday signed a free-trade agreement which will go into effect upon ratification, PAP news agency said.
Under the deal agricultural products would be divided into four groups in which customs tariffs would be lowered at different rates.

Poland is to retain tariffs on products from sectors undergoing restructuring such as cars, petroleum and steel and their reduction would reflect timetables established in the Central European Free Trade Agreement (CEFTA) and with the European Union (EU).

The agreement was signed by the two countries' foreign ministers in the presence of Polish President Aleksander Kwasniewski and Latvian President Guntis Ulmanis who is on his first official visit to Poland.

"Our sovereign, independent states have similar aims -- we want to become members of the EU and ensure ourselves the greatest securty possible within Europe's new structures," PAP quoted Kwasniewski as saying.
